pullRequest.title: Url parameter template support.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #2740
Fixes #4213
Fixes the 2 above issues by defining a low level API that works with @Route, @RoutePrefix and @RouteAlias, which supports parameters within the route string in following format:

path/to/:paramName
path/to/:paramName/foo

Parameter accepting only values matching a regular expression:

path/to/:paramName(regex)/foo

Optional parameters may be defined as:

path/to/:paramName?/foo
path/to/:paramName?(regex)/foo

Wildcard parameter (it is accepted only as the last segment template):

path/to/:paramName*
path/to/:paramName*(regex)

Multiple parameters may be combined within the path:

path/to/:paramName1/:paramName2?
path/to/:paramName1/:paramName2?/foo
path/to/:paramName1/foo/:paramName2/bar
path/to/:paramName1(regex)/foo/:paramName2?/bar/:paramName3*

Parameters are provided to views using BeforeEnterEvent.getRouteParameters() which returns a RouteParameters instance.
NOTE: In case of HasUrlParameter, the last parameter will be automatically defined so the value of @Route should not contain any parameter template defined as the last segment. In other words nothing changes to how HasUrlParameter is being used.


This change is

commit.message: Initial model test with no parameters
Working on test with eligible parameters disabled.
Look for target in optional children.
Handle wildcard transformation from list into UrlParameters
Store parameter patterns segments in insertion order.
UrlParameters compatibility and fix more tests
Change format to match with path-to-regexp.
Move test url params in RoutePrefix.
Use router layouts from RouteTarget when handle a UI request.
Use only regex for parameter type.
Remove FIXME and make RouteFormat internal.
Rename to urlTemplate. Change if (routeLayoutTypes == null).
Add UI.navigate with url params test.
